content.body: i guess this is the first time i've done modern JS development, for ecmarkup
i am not a fan of these eslint rules
bakkot Michael Ficarra https://github.com/tc39/ecmarkup/pull/362 should have all the fixes and changes we discussed on the call, minus docs
content.formatted_body: bakkot Michael Ficarra https://github.com/tc39/ecmarkup/pull/362 should have all the fixes and changes we discussed on the call, minus docs

content.body: i didn't see a structured header doc section in the existing docs, and i didn't feel like writing one :P
also the `<emu-meta>` tag now _does_ go over the entire invocation
content.formatted_body: also the <emu-meta> tag now does go over the entire invocation

content.body: the xref is just checking for `parentElement`. additionally, putting it around just the AO name actually doesn't work correctly, because then the autolinker can't tell it's an invocation
content.formatted_body: the xref is just checking for parentElement. additionally, putting it around just the AO name actually doesn't work correctly, because then the autolinker can't tell it's an invocation

content.body: since the check for that is just the real naive "is the next character a '('"
`npm run lint -- --fix` will fix a majority of the things the linter complains about
content.formatted_body: npm run lint -- --fix will fix a majority of the things the linter complains about

content.body: which is a lot less painful than fixing them yourself
re: docs, that's fine, I'll add docs for structure headers and effects at some point
ah, good tip, didn't know about `--fix`
content.formatted_body: ah, good tip, didn't know about --fix

content.body: you can also configure your editor to automatically run eslint autofix on save
if i ever have to be productive in a language other than C++ i am screwed
i'm sure you can configure your operating system to do it too :-p

> <@ljharb:matrix.org> you can also configure your editor to automatically run eslint autofix on save

I've never understood how anyone can stand this - saving shouldn't _change_ the file; I'm saving precisely because I am at a point where I do not want it to change!
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @ljharb:matrix.org
you can also configure your editor to automatically run eslint autofix on save
I've never understood how anyone can stand this - saving shouldn't change the file; I'm saving precisely because I am at a point where I do not want it to change!

content.body: ¯\_(ツ)_/¯ for me it's that that's the point where i don't want the semantics to change, autofixes don't change the AST
content.formatted_body: ¯_(ツ)_/¯ for me it's that that's the point where i don't want the semantics to change, autofixes don't change the AST
